description: Targeted biopharmaceuticals combining monoclonal antibodies with cytotoxic drugs via chemical linkers.
Therapeutic approaches using viral vectors (AAV, Lentivirus) to deliver genetic material for treating genetic disorders.
Therapeutic products containing live microorganisms for treating diseases through microbiome modulation.
Synthetic nucleic acid-based therapeutics including ASOs, siRNAs, and mRNAs.
Engineered or naturally occurring viruses that selectively replicate in and destroy cancer cells.
Short chains of amino acids used as therapeutic agents, typically 2-50 amino acids.
Bifunctional molecules that induce targeted protein degradation via the ubiquitin-proteasome system.
Proteins produced through recombinant DNA technology, including enzymes, hormones, and cytokines.
